snippet: In its celebration, the magazine is striving for what its editor called “a delicate balance,” capitalizing on longevity without appearing too long in the tooth to be contemporary.
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes magazine Woman's Day launches a commemoration of its 75th anniversary, capitalizing on longevity without appearing too long in the tooth to be contemporary.
lead_paragraph: In its celebration, the magazine is striving for what its editor called “a delicate balance,” capitalizing on longevity without appearing too long in the tooth to be contemporary.

headline.seo: Woman’s Day Turns 75 While Looking Forward
headline.main: Woman’s Day Turns 75 While Looking Forward
headline.print_headline: Woman’s Day Turns 75 While Looking Forward
